Under the updated Criminal Code, individuals using unauthorized cryptocurrency exchange services face up to two years in prison for basic transactions and up to five years for transactions exceeding 500 million Hungarian forints. The legislation's broad language and lack of implementation guidelines have created a legal gray area where previously legal activities could now result in criminal prosecution.
